intro: Ledebouria botryoides, commonly known as the starry bulbous plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Asparagaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped white or pale blue flowers during the summer months. Its bulbous structure allows it to store water, making it drought-tolerant. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique floral display.
